Hi fellow developers.

The latest post by Jake Wharton on not using Hungarian Notation make me think some lack of consistency on good practices and guidelines among Java/Android. I have published a little GitHub repo with a file containing some guidelines and good practices.

At the companies I worked for I have advocated for having such a file, where coding standards can be discussed and improved (since they are generally an ongoing and dynamic process).

Feel free to send your feedback and criticism.

<https://github.com/kikoso/android-coding-guidelines/>
<@U0K1ALDQE>: i user the newIsntance pattern for fragments, makes it less verbose when you need to pass in arguments to it.

<@U061HDV96>: of course not. The article of Jake provides many good arguments against that.
<@U04U5KS3Z>: give a try to fragment args too man
<@U061HDV96>: it does not pretend to be a fully compilable project, but a fast reference of coding guidelines.

<@U0K1ALDQE>: is tabs instead of spaces, Github format them wrongly. There are some advantages of using tabs over using spaces. 

- Tabs are only used for indentation. Spaces for separation of code elements (except obviously indentation)
- More productive (why clicking four times instead of once)
- Take more space than a space
- Mistakes are more noticeable

I always hate the tab v spaces argument. ‘More productive’ is a strawman, every IDE handles ‘tabs as spaces’ properly. Using tabs makes a difference in IDE settings (just like Github did) and honestly that’s  more effort to correct. Spaces are ALWAYS the same in every IDE with a monospaced font.
Not trying to start an argument, I’d rather rant about Egyptian braces vs newlines (i.e. C#-style) and how the newlines DON’T MATTER in the world with mouse wheels. or two-finger scroll.
i only switched to spaces because of github haha
otherwise i don't really care either way
I do like that AS (or intelliJ) allow you to set c# style in formatting, but I never use it because I know other java purists would scoff at it
I just end up with a ton of empty lines anyway

Hey guys, do you know of a simple way to use 2 different Share intents?
Mainly wanting to do a simple FAB share that will share to email or messages like slack but have a different intent if its email or simple Message
what do you mean by use? just fire a different intent when the content matches a regex for email
<@U0M1CFR7B|garettarrowood> has joined the channel

not sure how i would regex for email, considering there a ton of different possible email clients unless you mean somehow resolving the type returned. Is there a callback for the chooser to state what app was selected? and if so should use a specific intent?
<@U0JGJJMLP>: android has a Patterns class which has regex Patterns for a bunch of different stuff, email included
you don't get the selected app from the chooser, the system opens it for you
just match the content of your share intent against the regex for email from Patterns, if you get a match then you can populate the information into the email intent

hey guys, I have a scroll view. Inside it is some views, then a list of items. It’s really slow to inflate 30 objects that are going to be below the fold, and I shouldn’t put a listview inside a scrollview. What do?
I guess I could add the view to the top as an entry of the list, but is there any other way?
<@U0CHUGUDN|1mike12> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/1mike12/F0M1KGNGN/-.xml|Untitled> and commented: How do you do this?

file.name: -.xml
file.title: Untitled
file.preview_highlight:
<ScrollView>
	<SomeView/>
	<ListView/>
</ScrollView>

text: exactly how you mentioned, inflating a view in the header position and applying an offset in the adapter to account for that
i'm sure there's libraries which abstract that into some nice functions, maybe TwoWayView?
ScrollViews demand that they only have one child view
ListView really doesn't like being inside a ScrollView and i'm sure recyclerview doesn't either
I remember having to copy paste some weird hack from SO when I tried it before
but why would you use two scrolling views in your layout?
<@U0M1NNUSU|ethanl> has joined the channel
he probably just needs a header at the top that scrolls with the list
Yeah, theres a graph at the top, but really any arbitrary view. Then I list out a bunch of stuff. It’d be nice not to inflate all 20 some odd rows at once when only 2 are needed at the very beginning
the inflation of views should really be controlled by the listview. listview should only be drawing views which are on screen at the time
why are you saying you're inflating all of them?
can always use NestedScrollView :wink:
then he'd really be inflating all of them

Go to Settings > Build, Execution, Deployment > Instant Run if you want to tweak them again.The reason we had to do this is that these settings are (currently) actually per project settings, not per user.
